items.title: Ballroom community takes over State Library of Victoria for LGBTQIA+ Fantasy Ball
items.summary: From a fairy-themed beginners' performance to the revered "sex siren" category, participants vied for 10s on a night celebrating queer and trans people of colour at the State Library of Victoria.

items.title: The tide takes away his work each day, but learning to let go has transformed this artist
items.summary: Mal Leckie has spent every morning over the past 50 years at the beach, but when illness hurt his ability to surf, he had to find a new reason to get out of bed.

items.title: It was an audacious idea for a Liberals-Greens government, but did anyone stop to ask what Canberra voters would think?
items.summary: The idea of a coalition between the ACT Greens and the Canberra Liberals appears to be on hold for now — but a quick history lesson is important to understand how both sides were willing to consider it.

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka the Australian Open final favourite but Elena Rybakina pledges 'fight to the end'
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina are poised for a heavyweight bout in the Australian Open women's singles final, a rematch of a the classic 2023 decider.

items.title: What we know about the suspected murder-suicide of a Perth family of four
items.summary: An entire family has been found dead in their own home — a mother, a father and their two teenage boys, with police describing the event as "highly distressing" and a "devastating tragedy".

items.title: Beckham saga is an age-old heartache with an uncomfortably modern twist
items.summary: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.

items.title: Crochet octopus toys bring tactile comfort to premature babies at Western Sydney NICUs
items.summary: With materials, time and love, Bernice Joy Luxford has brought comfort to the sick infants and their emotionally and physically exhausted caregivers via over 700 octopus toys.

items.title: Families continue fight for railway crossing upgrades 25 years after horror Gerogery fatalities
items.summary: Barry Wooden has spent decades trying to honour the lives of his son and four mates who died in a horror railway crossing crash 25 years ago.

items.title: Man jailed for introducing amphetamines to 'vulnerable' teenagers in state care
items.summary: A man who introduced teenage sisters in state care to amphetamines was "well-aware" the drug was "dangerous, addictive and can destroy lives", a judge has said.

items.title: Australian Open 2026: Cramping Carlos causes controversy, an AO ultra marathon and Aussies win mixed doubles — quick hits from Melbourne Park
items.summary: Gadecki and Peers make their own bit of history and "old man" Djokovic turns back the clock to reach his 11th Aussie final. Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Australian Open.

items.title: Ensay's annual Mountain Calf Sale moved to Bairnsdale for animal welfare
items.summary: The tiny Victorian town of Ensay has proudly hosted the annual mountain calf sale for decades, but the yards will be empty this year.

items.title: Push for retailers to play role in 3D-printed gun crackdown after Bondi attack
items.summary: Hardware stores would report customers suspected of building 3D-printed guns to the authorities under fresh calls for corporate Australia to play a role in thwarting access to the deadly weapons

items.title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies aged 71
items.summary: The Canadian-born actress died at her home in Los Angeles at the age of 71 "following a brief illness", according to a statement from her agency.

items.title: To understand Melania Trump's movie we might need to follow the money
items.summary: Dire box office sales surrounding the US first lady's bio-doc have made headlines, but some argue there's likely a good reason Jeff Bezos's Amazon MGM Studios has splashed so much cash on MELANIA.

items.title: Keith, Barry Hall and a c-bomb: How Playlunch tore through the 2025 Hottest 100
items.summary: Keith, the incendiary single from Melbourne seven-piece Playlunch, has ripped through the hearts, minds and ears of fans around Australia and the world.

items.title: Australia's solar panel waste is mounting. Will the government's recycling scheme solve it?
items.summary: Australia is on the brink of a solar panel waste crisis. Experts say there's much to do before a national recycling program can stand on its own two feet.

items.title: Mimili artists talk of Country, community, survival in remote APY Lands
items.summary: The artists of Mimili, in the APY Lands of South Australia, are using new methods to share crucial knowledge of Country and culture, including repurposed car parts.

items.title: Children living in makeshift tents in Gaza are dying from hypothermia
items.summary: Mohammed died from hypothermia while in his mother's arms after a cold night in Gaza. His family are one of hundreds of thousands of Gazans enduring harsh winter conditions in flimsy tents across the enclave.

items.title: Novak Djokovic hits out at critics after epic Australian Open win over Jannik Sinner
items.summary: After beating two-time defending champion Jannik Sinner in five gruelling sets, Novak Djokovic sets his sights on those who doubted whether he could still be an Australian Open contender.

items.title: US official insists DoJ 'did not protect' Trump as new Epstein files released — as it happened
items.summary: More than 2,000 videos and 180,000 images have been released as part of the batch, which comes weeks after a legally mandated deadline signed by Donald Trump. Look back on how the day unfolded.

items.title: Taylor Liberals' leading man as leadership spill looms
items.summary: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

items.title: Donald Trump's many foreign policy bluffs come at a political price
items.summary: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

items.title: More than 3 million new 'Epstein files' released by US government
items.summary: The US Department of Justice says it is releasing more than 3 million new documents from the "Epstein files", but Democrats question why millions more are being withheld.

items.title: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty if convicted over UnitedHealthcare CEO's murder
items.summary: A judge in Manhattan throws out federal murder and weapons charges against the 27-year-old, saying they are not legally compatible with the other charges of stalking he faces.

items.title: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon arrested on charges related to anti-ICE protest
items.summary: The arrest comes after Don Lemon live-streamed a demonstration that interrupted a church service in St Paul, Minnesota, earlier this month while protesting against President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in the area.

items.title: Donald Trump announces Kevin Warsh as next Fed chair, replacing Jerome Powell

items.title: Australian Open 2026: Alexander Zverev takes issue with Carlos Alcaraz's injury timeout during semifinal

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz downs Alexander Zverev in ultimate match of margins as Australian Open finally delivers epic

items.title: Jury finds New South Wales man Gregory Carr guilty of indecently touching two WA girls
items.summary: The 23-year-old man has been found guilty of indecently dealing with two girls in northern Western Australia.

items.title: Friday finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante charged with family violence, assault, burglary offences
items.summary: Australian online gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante has appeared in a Perth court, accused of a slew of family violence, drugs and burglary offences.

items.title: Albanese government urged to use careful diplomacy to defuse Darwin Port row with China
items.summary: Industry groups that suffered three years of damaging Chinese trade tariffs on products including barley are appealing to the federal government to exercise careful diplomacy to defuse tensions with China over the ownership of Darwin Port.

items.title: Gold and silver prices collapse ahead of announcement of new US Federal Reserve chair
items.summary: Gold and silver prices have plummeted, sparked by reports US President Donald Trump is set to announce a new US Federal Reserve chair.

items.title: More than $370 million now allocated for Victorian bushfire recovery support
items.summary: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

items.title: Man jailed over antisemitic graffiti spree in Sydney fails to have sentence overturned
items.summary: Mohommed Farhat's lawyers were urging the court to overturn the sentence on appeal and replace it with an intensive correction order which could have seen him released.

items.title: Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley for Liberal Party leadership
items.summary: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal Party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley next week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: New Zealand has refused to join Donald Trump's 'Board of Peace'. What about the rest of the world?
items.summary: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

items.title: Man jailed for injecting girlfriend with meth 24 hours before she died
items.summary: A man who injected his girlfriend with methamphetamine in the 24 hours before her sudden death has been jailed for just over nine months — but his sentence was backdated, meaning he will be eligible for release in May.

items.title: FBI seizes Georgia ballots as Trump pursues 2020 election grievance

items.title: Canberra woman charged with murder after man found dead in her Braddon unit

items.summary: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: Inpex under investigation after suspected sulphur dioxide exposure leaves worker in hospital
items.summary: The Australian Workers' Union has raised concerns after a worker at Inpex's Ichthys gas facility was allegedly exposed to sulphur dioxide and hospitalised, prompting an investigation by the NT workplace safety watchdog.

items.title: SA Arts Minister Andrea Michaels to quit politics after state election
items.summary: Andrea Michaels will not recontest her seat of Enfield, in Adelaide's inner north, but will remain in the cabinet until the March election.

items.title: Thousands of flying foxes die, hundreds rescued, amid record-breaking SA heatwaves
